subject: RE: [junit] how to avoid multiple initialization ?
msgSnippet: Please, Read the following answer to you question on the FAQ: http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#organize_3 I hope this will help to you, David ...
messageBody:
Please,

Read the following answer to you question on the FAQ:

http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#organize_3

I hope this will help to you,

David
-----Mensaje original-----
De: Kireitchik, Valeri [mailto:valeri.kireitchik@...]
Enviado el: lunes, 21 de julio de 2003 8:55
Para: junit@yahoogroups.com
Asunto: [junit] how to avoid multiple initialization ?


Dear all,

could you help in the following:

Several test are united in one test class. I want some initialization to
be done ONCE for all tests.
I sow only 2 possibilities where to place initialization code:
1) setUp() method
2) constructor
But both are called n times, where n is number of testXXX() methods. For
n=2 it looks like:
constructor is called
constructor is called
.setUp is called
testOne is called
.setUp is called
testTwo is called

So, could you please advice how to achive one-time initialization.

// SAMPLE CODE THAT PRODUCES ABOVE OUTPUT
package itc_m.pass.test;

import junit.framework.*;

public class TestOfOneTimeInit extends TestCase {

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(TestOfOneTimeInit.class);
}

public TestOfOneTimeInit(){
System.out.println("constructor is called");
}

protected void setUp(){
System.out.println("setUp is called");
}

public void testOne(){
System.out.println("testOne is called");
}

public void testTwo(){
System.out.println("testTwo is called");
}

}
